title: Reference fallible endgame play

references.title: Checkers: a Preview of What will Happen to Chess?
Computer Chess, News about the North American Computer Chess Championship.
Improving the Performance of Endgame Databases.
KQKR: Assessing the Utility of Heuristics.
KQKR: Awareness of a Fallible Opponent.
KQKR: Speculatively Thwarting a Human Opponent.

abstract: A reference model of fallible endgame play is defined in terms of a spectrum of endgame players whose play ranges in competence from random to optimal choice of move. They may be used as suitable practice partners, to differentiate between otherwise equi-optimal moves, to promote or expedite a result, to assess an opponent, to run Monte Carlo simulations, and to identify the difficulty of a position or a whole endgame
